question:
How the Saturated Fat is different from Unsaturated Fat?
1. Saturated Fat has no double bonds, while Unsaturated Fat has at least one double bond
2. Saturated Fats contain more energy in comparison to the Unsaturated Fats
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Saturated Fat has no double bonds, while Unsaturated Fat has at least one double bond. Unsaturated fats (monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats) are healthy fats as they can lower the risk of heart disease.
